intro: Pelexia stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pelexia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive and ecologically valuable addition to native plant gardens.
